title: Extend get_family for row-col parameter indices
body:
Function get_family_mcmc can be used to extract some family parameters and add information about parameter indices for advanced figures.  
This works for matrix Parameters: `Param[i,j]` returns column with `i` indices and one with `j` indices. This also works for vector Parameters (`Param[i]`).  
You can also add a name like col1, col2, ...

title: More control of aesthetics for ggs_caterpillar
body:
This PR adds several optional parameters for ggs_caterpillar:
- `thick_size` Width of thick band
- `thin_size` Width of thin band
- `point_size` Size of median point
- `linetype` Type of line for indicating a concrete position.
- `linesize` Width of line for indicating a concrete position.

title: Upgrade ggpairs example
body:
Hi @xfim,

Here's a pull request to fix the ggs_pairs example.  

I moved the GGally into imports, as you only import / need ggpairs.  You already had the import statement in place, so it should have no impact.  The CRAN people love to import vs. depend.

Quick note: 
- checking examples ... OK
  Examples with CPU or elapsed time > 5s
         user system elapsed
  ggs_pairs 8.917  0.163   9.420

The example takes longer than 5 seconds. If it's just one, they might let it slide, but they get mad at me. :-/ .  To get around this, I store the plotmatrix to a variable, then I comment the variable on the next line. 

Hope this helps!

Best,
Barret

title: add ggs_pairs function to make plot matrices
body:
Pairs plots are useful for assessing posterior correlation (e.g. [rstan::pairs.stanfit](https://github.com/stan-dev/rstan/blob/develop/rstan/rstan/R/pairs.R)). This function uses the [GGally::ggpairs](https://github.com/ggobi/ggally/blob/master/R/ggpairs.r) function along with the functionality in ggmcmc (especially get_family) to produce flexible pairs plots that can include actual points from posterior simulations, 2d density contours, coloration by chains, and other aesthetic tweaks (some shown in examples). Might be useful as a diagnostic tool - and any suggestions are welcome. 

``` r
ggs_pairs(ggs(s),
          upper=list(continuous="density", params=c(color="black")),
          lower=list(params=c(alpha=.2, shape=1))) + 
  theme_classic()
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2664564/8226016/3a99b7a2-1558-11e5-925f-3cf615bd02d1.png)

title: Fix bug causing order of parameters to get changed
body: I believe the goal here is to remove the unused levels of the factor. droplevels(D.sub$Parameter) should be used for this, because the use of factor(as.character(D.sub$Parameter)) was causing the existing ordering of the levels of Parameter to be lost and to be replaced with a purely alphabetical ordering. This was leading to "x[10]" coming before "x[2]" for example. As a result, in parameters were in the wrong order in many of the ggs_ plotting functions if the "family" option was used.

title: Param labeller
body:
I added a capability to `ggs_caterpillar` that allows the user to change the parameter labels right before plotting. 

It does this with two new options: `param_label_from` and `param_label_to`.

In theory it would be easy to add this capability to the other plotting functions.

I can send along a reproducible example if you would like.

title: Fix: issue #18 simple STAN test case
body:
In issue #18, @dmenne found that importing from STAN fails when only the chain has only one parameter. This pull-request fixes it. 

If errors subsist, I recommend merging pull-request #17 that uses reshape2, which will fix any problem with the `melt()` used in `ggs_chain()`.

title: Fix: import coda
body: @dmenne pointed in issue #18 that importing a Stan file uses coda, making it a required package, not a suggested package. This patch fixes the problem, and uses namespaces to avoid the warning pointed by Dieter.

title: separation and roc plot functions
body:
this is the simplest implementation of the separation plot I could work out. I tried a version with auto-faceting but the call in geom_vline is problematic for that. If you have a way to fix that (everything else works) I'll re-work it and re-issue the pull request. 

I also added a roc plot to the list. 

Let me know if there are any other changes I need to make. Sorry for the messy commit history.

title: ggs_caterpillar update
body:
I updated the function with the list functionality and (at least partially) the documentation. Let me know if I need to update anything else. I tested it with single models and lists and everything seems to be working fine. I added a few tests in the function to make sure it doesn't break.

One thing I did notice. If you write a ggs object to file and then read it and try to use the cater plot function it fails because of `attributes(D)$parallel` since the write out (at least to csv) removes this attribute. You could just make parallel default to false perhaps? 

Also, the file for the cater function has caterpillar spelled with only one 'l'.

Cheerio!
